com.example.cshare.ui.views.productlists

Class ProductListFragment

  • java.lang.Object
    • androidx.fragment.app.Fragment
      • com.example.cshare.ui.views.BaseFragment
        • com.example.cshare.ui.views.productlists.ProductListFragment
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.content.ComponentCallbacks, android.view.View.OnCreateContextMenuListener, androidx.lifecycle.LifecycleOwner, androidx.lifecycle.ViewModelStoreOwner, androidx.savedstate.SavedStateRegistryOwner
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CartFragment, HomeFragment, SharedFragment

    public abstract class ProductListFragment
extends BaseFragment
    Abstract ProductListFragment class, inheriting from the BaseFragment class, within which the global logic for recycler view is implemented
    Since:
    1.1
    Author:
    Clara Gros
    See Also:
    BaseFragment

      • configureSwipeRefreshLayout

        protected abstract void configureSwipeRefreshLayout()
        Configure the SwipeRefreshLayout

        Method to to add a listener to the SwipeRefreshLayout. The latter will be launched when the user performs a "Pull To Refresh" and triggers the onRefresh() method which will launch our usual stream.

      • getProducts

        protected abstract void getProducts()
        To be defined in the fragments inherited from this ProductListFragment class

        Calls the public methods of the ViewModel of the fragment (which stores the list of products to be displayed) the to observe the result.

        Whenever the the observe() method is alerted when the product list changes, the adapter of the recycler view is updated calling the method submitList

        See Also:
        PagedListAdapter.submitList(PagedList)
